conclusion: Determine velocity of conductor rod MN at constant speed considering forces and induced EMF.
Gravitational force F_g acts downward and is given by F_g = mg.
Magnetic force F_B acts upward due to interaction of current in rod with magnetic field.
Induced EMF in rod MN moving with velocity v in magnetic field B is given by E = B l v.
Resistance of rod MN is R = r l since resistance per unit length is r.
Current I induced in rod is I = E/R = B l v / r l = B v / r.
Magnetic force F_B on rod is F_B = I l B = (B v / r) l B = B^2 l^2 v / r.
At constant speed, net force on rod is zero, so gravitational force is balanced by magnetic force: mg = B^2 l^2 v / r.
Solve for velocity v: v = mgr / B^2 l^2.
Final answer: velocity v of conductor rod MN at constant speed is v = mgr / B^2 l^2.
